text: Park Jong-ah (born 13 June 1996) is a South Korean ice hockey player. She competed in the 2018 Winter Olympics. ==Career== Alongside North Korean Jong Su-hyon, Park was the penultimate torchbearer at the 2018 Winter Olympics opening ceremony. She competed in the 2018 Winter Olympics as captain of a unified team of 35 players drawn from both North and South Korea. The team's coach was Sarah Murray and the team was in Group B competing against Switzerland, Japan and Sweden. ==References== Category:1996 births Category:Living people Category:Ice hockey players at the 2018 Winter Olympics Category:South Korean women's ice hockey forwards Category:Olympic ice hockey players of South Korea Category:Winter Olympics competitors for Korea Category:Ice hockey players at the 2017 Asian Winter Games
title: Park Jong-ah
